article.description: Eric Eaves and Ed Stephens scored 22 points apiece to help South Carolina State beat Delaware State 90-79 on Saturday.
article.headline: South Carolina State holds off Delaware State for 90-79 win
article.linkText: South Carolina State holds off Delaware State for 90-79 win
article.story: ORANGEBURG, S.C. -- Eric Eaves and Ed Stephens scored 22 points apiece to help South Carolina State beat Delaware State 90-79 on Saturday. Stephens hit a career-high seven 3-pointers while Eaves added six rebounds and five assists. Ty Solomon finished with 13 points and Gabe McCray scored 12 for South Carolina State (9-10, 4-1 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference). The Bulldogs have won four in a row and scored at least 90 points in each of their last three games. Delaware State (1-15, 0-2) made just 10 of 29 (35.7 percent) field goal attempts in the first half and trailed 51-33 at the break, but hit eight 3-pointers after halftime and rallied to tie it at 68 with about five minutes left. South Carolina State scored 22 of the final 33 points. Devin Morgan Jr. led Delaware State with 21 points. Scott Sill hit four 3s and scored 12 -- both career highs.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
